fileheader.author: Richard Harrison
fileheader.description:
Models an F14-B with F110-GE-400 engines.
The aerodata used is from AFWAL-TR-80-3141 parts I and III which is for sweep of 22degrees, positive alpha, clean, low speed. NASA TM-X-62306 is used for longitudinal flaps, speedbrakes, gear and spoilers
The flaps, AUX flaps and slats coefficients are based on the values in NASA TM-X-62306 however this only gives us coefficients for 35 degrees of flaps and 17 degrees of slats; so the total value is divided up between flaps and slats with flaps contributing 80% of the total and slats the remaining 20%. Flaps are further divided with main contributing 70% and AUX 30% and also appropriate scaling for intermediate values of both slats and flaps.
Wingsweep and lateral spoilers are based on CFD computed values (OpenVSP).
The flight control system (FCS) is modelled based on the schematic data in NASA-TM-81833 - and also I model both the analog SAS and the digital SAS.
DLC is modelled based on the data in NASA-TM-81833 but also with both the original DLC which uses all spoilers between -4 and 17 degrees for both roll control and DLC and the mod AFC 735 which uses the inner spoilers for DLC using the full deflection (-4 +50) and the outer spoilers for roll control.
ACLS is not currently modelled - I'm hoping that I will discover enough information to enable an accurate model to be built.
APC is also based on the schematic data in NASA-TM-81833.
Engine Thrust are based on NASA-TM-104326 tables 4-6 adjusted for altitude and with augmentation figures based on that of the mil thrust.
fileheader.note: Aircraft origin for measurements is the nose.
The aerodynamic and FCS model are based on accurate aerodata with the exceptions in the limitations section below.
fileheader.limitation: Wingsweep and lateral spoilers are based on CFD computed values (OpenVSP).

function.name: aero/coefficients/Cmach
function.description: Mach factor (all except drag) (NASA-TM-84643 Figure 3 Clalpha) and values for AOA derived from NASA-aaia-2000-0900 Figure 4

function.name: aero/coefficients/CdTNK
function.description: Incremental Cd due to external tanks

function.name: aero/coefficients/ClSweepFactor
function.description: Wing sweep factor from norm of 22 (NASA-TM-D-6909)
